Key Arguments: The bill threatens to strip citizens of their freedoms.
It grants excessive power to the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA).
The bill exempts governmental publications from scrutiny.
Vague standards and severe fines will lead to censorship of controversial discussions.
Free speech, including unpopular opinions, is essential for intellectual growth and protection of individual rights.
Notable Quotes: This bill grants excessive power to the Australian Communications and Media Authority to regulate and restrict the public's access to diverse information.
A society that values free speech must be willing to protect even the most unpopular opinions.
